activities.loc: Br 10 - Law Enforcement Center - West Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel Joesph Kurszewski

records.addlTxt:
1:15 PM Defendant Daniel Joesph Kurszewski not in court, in custody.  Attorney Benjamin Wallis Lutgen in court for Daniel Joesph Kurszewski.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Prosecuting attorney Chris D Steenrod in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Sara Rogan. 

Defense indicates that defendant refuses to get out of bed.  
Comp evaluation received/reviewed by parties. Defendant incompetent though may retain competency. 

Order for Treatment is needed.

BTC:  Defendant is incompetent to proceed; more likely to become competent. Defendant incapable of distinguishing use of medication; Judge to sign order for medication to be given to defendant. A 90-day Review set; defendant's appearance waived. Matter set over for review hearing in about 90 days.
Review hearing scheduled for January 23, 2023 at 11:00 am.
Review hearing on January 23, 2023 at 11:00 am.

1:28 PM Defendant Daniel Joesph Kurszewski in court, in custody.  Attorney Benjamin Wallis Lutgen in court for Daniel Joesph Kurszewski.  Attorney Chris D Steenrod in court for State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter: Sara Rogan. 
Matter set to address letter filed by defense counsel regarding competency. 
Defense indicates the defendant has not had medication while in the jail, requests evaluation be done. 
BTC: Court will order a competency examination.
Competency hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: No firearms. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
